page.title: 10Bicester Garrison Life (2)
page.content: 1THE ARMY MEDICAL CENTRE is a smallish building near the NAAFI.If you are ill you come here.There is often a long wait to see the doctor.Up to 2 hours! Before you get to see the doctor you make an appointment.You come in & sit down.Usually there are a few magazines to read while waiting.A lady calls your name& you go through to another Waiting Room & then into the Surgery.When I went the doctor was Asian.He looked at my foot & wrote a note which he told me to take next door where a nurse gave me a tube of Glaxo Dermorate Cream.Back in the Waiting Room as usual there were lots of mothers & babies. (K. WHITE) BINGO is a popular game played weekly in the Village Hall from 7.15\9.30.Aman calls a number & you cross it out if it is on your card.When all your numbers are crossed out you shout"House"orBingo & you win some money. (LEE WEBBER).
